page.title: 01COAST WEST OF TOTRONALD
page.content: Most of GR01120756 is the Atlantic Ocean, off the west coast of the Isle of Coll with the exception of square 12 where the coast itself covers about half of that square. This area of ground is used as rough grazing for sheep and cattle. It is pretty rocky between the vegetation with many bogs, the highest of the rocks being about 30 metres. The coast line is mainly rocky with the exception of one or two sandy bays where dune grassland has formed immediately after the beach. The grassland has been drained in former times by the use of "lazy-beds" and are today still quite obvious. On these beaches a wide variety of drift items line the hightide mark. There are no trees or shrubs on the land. There is also a few rocky islands just off the coastline.
